FuncDef:
The nat alarm server-map threshold command sets an alarm threshold for server-map entry usage so that an alarm is generated if the threshold is reached.
The undo nat alarm server-map threshold command restores the default alarm threshold for server-map entry usage.
The default alarm threshold for server-map entry usage is 80%.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an alarm threshold for server-map entry usage.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 90, in percentage.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Run the display nat memory-usage servermap command to query the number of used server-map entries and the number of supported server-map entries. To monitor server-map entry usage, run the nat alarm server-map threshold command to set an alarm threshold for server-map entry usage.
Configuration Impact
If server-map entry usage reaches the specified alarm threshold, a service board sends an alarm to the NMS. If server-map entry usage exceeds the alarm threshold, the service board does not repeatedly send an alarm. After server-map entry usage falls to 87.5% of the threshold, the service board sends a clear alarm to the NMS.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
